Fields.DialogueText: Oh, for the love of - Nagatsuki!
Yes, Captain...
Oh, hell. Is that what I think it is?!
What? Huh?! Nooo... please, don't tell me that's my gramophone record...
Sorry. I mean, it shouldn't have been on the bridge at all, and I wouldn't have broken it if there hadn't been crap on the floor that... oh, please don't cry.
It's got my favorite song - and to be honest, that record is irreplaceable - but there's nothing I can do about it now, is there?

Fields.MenuText: Yeah. "Try." I'm sorry I broke something that wasn't where it was supposed to be, but neither one of us really wants to take a break from the war to replace it.
Yeah. "Try." I'll do my best, but I can't make any promises.
Okay. No "try." I'll get the record.

Fields.DialogueText: Hai, hai. "Try" will do. Barely.
Hmph... I know that it won't be easy to find another. I'm really disappointed, Kanchou.
Get creative, Kanchou... you'll make it work. I'm sure of it!
*ALARM*
Oh, good. Morganas.
@BATTLE
I've tidied up... I guess I'll be on my way. I have fleet exercises to prepare for.
I am sorry about the the record, Nagatsuki.
I know... it's okay, Kanchou. Mata ne.
Frederic. I assume the Kami of the ship is surfing?
That seems like a safe bet, Captain. She is technically off-duty now.
Nagatsuki!
*sigh*
And I'd be fine with that if she hadn't left the bridge looking like a child's bedroom. Help me gather some of this stuff up - we can have it delivered to her quarters.
*CRACK*
Oh, now you've done it!
I'm not going to cry!
Look, if you agree not to leave it on the bridge, I'll try to find a replacement. Just...
"Try," Kanchou?
Wow, it looks wonderful in here... what's different?
Oh, you've noticed. I decided the bridge needed a thorough cleaning, so Frederic and I did just that.

Fields.MenuText: Seems rather suspicious... but nonetheless, thank you.
What are you both up to?! I don't have time for your foolishness, Nagatsuki... Frederic.
Great! You two did such a wonderful job. Care to extend your services into my quarters? It desperately needs a dusting.

Fields.DialogueText: We cleaned the bridge because it's the reason my record broke! I'm glad it works in your favor, Kanchou - HMPH!
I figured this would help you be less clumsy, Kanchou. It makes sense now... when you spoke of cleanliness it was to ward off your recklessness!
It was the only thing I could think to do to keep you from breaking anything else that's not yours, Kanchou. I assume everything you own is already rubble on the floor.
Uh-huh. Well, thank you all the same.
So, about my replacement record...
*ALARM*
We don't have time for this, Nagatsuki! Look!
Oh, I knew they were coming. What I had to say was more important. Plus, they're far enough that we've got plenty of time...
NAGATSUKI, NOT NOW!
@BATTLE
I told you we had plenty of time. Did you want to join me out in the water, Kanchou?
Umm, no. I have... things to do here.
Hai, hai... I'll get you a list of places you might find that record. Mata ne!
*sigh*
If I don't get that thing, I foresee restlessness in my future....
All hands to battlestations! Teki no fune ga chikadzuite imasu!
@BATTLE
Hmm, the fleet seemed a little bit out of sync out there. Has anything changed, Nagatsuki?
I've implemented the grace of DANCE in our exercises. A little awkward... but they'll get better.

Fields.MenuText: What does dance have to do with war?! Put a stop to it at once.
Interesting. I'll give it a fortnight and if things haven't improved, I want you to put an end to it.
Yes... I trust that you have it in control.

Fields.DialogueText: It has a lot to do with war, Kanchou. Our movements are a dance with death... coaxing her to grace us with another day...
You wouldn't understand. You'd have to be able to think abstractly... can you do that, Kanchou?
Like I told you, they'll get better. You'll see... when they've got it down, you're going to be impressed with how closely related dance and war really are.
There's no use arguing what's right. You have a couple of weeks to convince me.
Glad you're seeing it my way! Oh, here's the list of places you might find my record.
Yes, actually - I'd like that very much. And I'll take a look at this list, but like I've told you before... no promises.
Great! I'll be by to get you after exercises. Mata ne!
I - I didn't mean... I guess I'm going out for sushi tonight.
By the way, I hear there's somebody selling fresh sushi at the dock - close enough for Belles to stop in. Would you care to join me when we finally reach port?
The sushi meal was a lot of fun, Kanchou. Too bad you couldn't find the record, but I had a good time nonetheless.
Oh, are you heading out?
I was going to take the board out. Umm, our night together doesn't have to end. You can come with... I'd love your company.

Fields.MenuText: Oh, no... I've got plenty to do here. I had a great time too, Nagatsuki.
Sure! Most of things here can wait a while longer, right?
I don't know... I think I'd rather stay here where it's warm.

Fields.DialogueText: Come on, Kanchou. It's just a quick ride. No one will notice us gone any longer than we were.
Yatta! Quick, let's go before more work shows up looking for you!
You need some form of exercise other than what we must do, Kanchou. If you happen to change your mind, you're always welcome.
You know what... let's go. A few more minutes won't change anything.
*ALARM*
... Mattaku.
Another time?
@BATTLE
That was fast. Did you notice the crew's swift moves?
Actually, I did. That's the dance training?
Well, come on. It's getting late and you need to make your bedtime, tee hee!
You mean now? I said another time... not after the battle.
This is another time. Yes or no?
Umm... yes. Let's go.
Hai. Of course.
Hai! Of course!
Look what I found, Kanchou.
First, promise me it's not going to end up on the floor of the bridge.
... Funny. It's the address of the store that may have my record!
May... that's the key word.
I see that you're latching on to something, but you didn't let me finish, Kanchou.
Well, go on. When you pause, it's an invitation for me to respond.
It's for dramatic effect! As I was saying, they may have it. And the reason I'm saying it in that manner is because it is in stock, but they will not hold it for me.
That's ridiculous. How popular can this "September in the Rain" record be?
It's not just any record, Kanchou! It's a song by Harry Warren and Al Dubin. And they are wonderful!

Fields.MenuText: I think a good quarter of the crew would disagree with that, actually.
What are you waiting for, then? Find somebody to go get it for you!
Okay. I concede the point.

Fields.DialogueText: One, you're obviously mistaken. Two, you should be hurrying us to port so you can get to that store before they sell out - you broke it, you replace it!
That's what I'm doing now, Kanchou! Honestly, I don't think you're getting enough sleep.
Come on, I need you to go get it before it's gone.
*ALARM*
I won't be able to leave until that is taken care of...
Ugh... can these things give me a break?! All right, and then we'll get my record, baby!
@BATTLE
Hell. Nagatsuki, I hate to say it, but I've got to report to the port authority after this mess. You can find money in my quarters - find a crew member with shore leave pending and delegate.
Oh... okay. Arigatō!
I just passed by Nagatsuki and I've never seen her look so... sad.
Oh... yeah. By the time she found a crew member who could get to the record store, the record in question was gone. They sold it minutes before she got there.
Why are you smiling? I feel bad for the girl - that record meant a lot to her. Well... the song, anyway.
What do you mean? Sentimental value?
Something like that... not something to smile about now, is it, Captain?
I wasn't smiling because she's miserable. I'm smiling because I tracked a copy of the damn record down myself.
That... seems like it could backfire.

Fields.MenuText: You think so? I'm hoping it'll be more of a happy surprise.
Frederic, it's not like we'll be waiting weeks for her to start teasing me.
I guess it does. Whatever. The important thing is that she'll have it in the end.

Fields.DialogueText: Captain... I don't know how well she's going to take to this surprise of yours.
It's your funeral, Captain. I hope I'm not there when it happens!
Captain, I advise you to wear a helmet when you present it to her.
Frederic, it's okay. I'm not going to let this play out indefinitely. Assuming it gets here in one piece, I'll give it to her at an opportune moment and throw in a dinner.
Good luck, Captain!
I don't need luck, Frederic. I have what she wants - her record.
@BATTLE
And you haven't told her?
It's not here yet. After that, I'll just wait for the right moment. Preferably when she's berating me for being a killjoy.
Yes, yes... I see. How about the night after? Okay, that'll work. Bye.
Who were you talking to? Sounds important.
Hi, Nagatsuki. It was nothing... no one. How was your lunch?
Okay. It was good - and the conversation was rather interesting. A comrade of mine heard some rumors--

Fields.MenuText: ... Why are you looking at me like that?
Rumors about our ship? Someone on deck?
Ha! I'm sure it's something good... what's it about?

Fields.DialogueText: You're acting weird. Why are you acting weird?
A bit jumpy, don't you think? And rude! As I was saying...
The rumors are like a pus-filled pimple about to pop!
Go on. Sorry to have interrupted.
Well, the rumors are about a couple on board. I guess one's hiding something from the other.
Okay. Maybe it's for a surprise or something. Sometimes people take things out of context.
No, I don't think so. I think it's along the lines of being deceitful. How can keeping something from someone be taken any other way?
Seems a bit odd that this sort of thing amuses you, Nagatsuki... I expected your conversations to be... you know... more fulfilling.
What's that supposed to mean? Gossip can be quite enlightening - as long as one takes care not to spread it around too recklessly.
She says as she spreads it around.
Ha! Perhaps. But who are you going to tell? Ha, ha, ha!
*ALARM*
Funny... let's get back to work.
@BATTLE
You're looking quite pale, Kanchou... was it something I said?
All hands to battlestations! Hayakushite kudasai!
@BATTLE
You changed fast and very fancy. Where are you heading to, Nagatsuki?
Oh, I'm meeting with a few surfer comrades. An unofficial gathering for itago masters!
Sounds like fun! Don't let me keep you.
I still have some time. I like to trot around in what I'm wearing beforehand anyway.
Why? Don't you want your clothes to be at their most pristine?
I like wearing them in. It feels a lot more comfortable and then I'm not worrying about what's on my body.
I suppose that's a way to look at things.
It's just stuff, Kanchou. Ha, if it weren't considered indecent I might go about in nothing at all!

Fields.MenuText: You're as crazy as they come, Nagatsuki!
Yeah, but that might encourage the crew to do the same. I don't think my eyes could take it.
... Tell me more.

Fields.DialogueText: Think about it... all this stuff we care about and hold on to means nothing at all in the end. Yet we do it to fit in with our family, friends... they're what matters when it's said and done.
I guess I'm just being silly. Either way, it's just cloth to cover what I was created with.
Wouldn't that be a sight to see! My friends would be horrified to say the least!
Something on your mind, Nagatsuki?
I'm still sad about the record. I almost had my hands on another copy and was just minutes too late. I had to stop for edomae-zushi! It was calling me...
Listen, about that...
You don't have to say anything, Kanchou. It's just stuff. I'll get over it, I'm sure.
Yeah, but...
Oh! I have to go! Thanks for listening to my rants!
... Oh, good grief.
*ALARM*
Frederic! What the hell is going on now?!
Fire!
Point the way.
Just follow me, Captain. I'm...
You're overreacting. They've got it under control. It just seems frightening because of the smoke, but that's all it is... smoke.
So... what was the cause and where is it?
A rag was left near one of the burners in the galley. Your tone sounds like you're anxious. Don't scream fire before the flames are evident.

Fields.MenuText: ... Want to rethink that and try again?
What's wrong? You don't sound like yourself, Nagatsuki...
Fair enough - though I don't recall doing any screaming.

Fields.DialogueText: Pardon me, Kanchou.
I sound however I like!
... Gomen. I am not myself today.
If you want to talk about it, I'm here. There's no need to go about stressed and angry.
It's nothing.
Wait. What happened to your surfboard?
I'll catch up with you later, Kanchou. Mata ne.
Hmm, she's really upset, Captain.
I see that! Is everything all right in the galley?
Yes, Captain. You're going to have to give her that surprise soon. I don't like her like this... when she's in a funk, the whole crew feels it.
I know, I know. She just has a way of vanishing whenever I try to bring the subject up.
@BATTLE
I mean, I would talk to you if I were really down.
Okay, you talked me into it. I don't have my music to fall back on, and now my surfboard needs some tweaking. I'm just feeling really down.
Doesn't really matter. I just have to do a few things before I can take it out.
I'll go check it out, Captain.
Very good.
But that dinner is in the works, and I can spring it on her then. Knock on wood.
Kanchou, what's this? Is this... You didn't... YOU DID!
You know - I had a plan. Gift, dinner. It was going to be great.
Dinner? I... wasn't? Wait... what?

Fields.MenuText: I don't suppose I can get you to give that back and pretend you never saw it.
Surprise!
Well, it's out now. I guess I might as well come clean.

Fields.DialogueText: You have a lot to explain, Kanchou. But how can I be upset?! You found my record!
Surprise? I love surprises! How exciting...
I don't know what's going on and I'm not sure whether or not I should be happy or sad!
So, my plan was to give you the record after dinner. It was a surprise I've been putting together.
Ooh, edomae-zushi?! Where did you find the record? I was sure I'd never get a replacement!
Yes, edomae-zushi. And that... well, after you had bad luck at the store I started calling in some favors. I've had it for a few days now.
Wait?! Ha! That's crazy! I'd never think you had it in you, Kanchou... Wow, I'm surprised, indeed!
Um... thanks? You mean that as a compliment, right?
Hai! You've tricked me, sure. But you meant well and that's what matters to me! Come here... mmm!
Ha ha... that was quite the hug! Strong arms... I'm glad you're happy, Nagatsuki. Umm, the dinner. Will you join me for a night out?
Hai! Absolutely! I knew there was a reason I kept seeing my lucky number 30 all over the place.
It's a date!
@BATTLE
You've been in my quarters? ... Of course you've been in my quarters.
Nagatsuki, we're receiving intel. Have you seen Frederic?
Hai. I'll go fetch him - one moment.
Great.
Hmm... I wonder what they've got in store for us now.
Captain! Nagatsuki filled me in, but it'll take me a few.
Understood. Report to me when you're done. Nagatsuki, standby.
It's not like I've got anything better to do... the fleet exercises I schedule are just to play, you know.
Ha, ha. It can wait. Depending on what's received, you may have to reschedule your fun.
We have fun battling all the time... like right now. Look up...
Fantastic. Okay, let's take care of these guys. We may have bigger fish to fry, but for now, we're fighting ghosts!
@BATTLE
That wasn't too bad, Kanchou. We killed time while we waited for the next invitation to our possible demise.

Fields.MenuText: Very funny. Ha. Is that what you wanted me to say?
Our duty is priority, Nagatsuki. I expect you to take it seriously.
Heh. It *is* more interesting than watching bored sailors play ping-pong, I'll give you that.

Fields.DialogueText: I speak of truth. Although its delivery may be welcomed by few, it is still truth.
You should see the look on your face. I know what will get your motor going now! Ha!
I still think you need to spend more of your idle time surfing, mind you.
Oh, Nagatsuki...
Frederic, have you got that thing ready yet?
Yes, Captain... I didn't want to interrupt.
Reassignment to Southwest Area Fleet. Prepare voyage towards Singapore. Standby.
That was all that came in, Captain.
All right... looks like we're heading to Singapore. Notify the crew, Frederic. And, Nagatsuki, that exercise will have to wait.
Hai, hai! Ooh, new waters... Wait... our dinner?
That will have to be rescheduled, as well... it will happen, just not as planned.
Teehee! A surprise, then!
Nagatsuki, what's our current status?
Well, you've replaced my record and we're going on a dinner date some time in the future, so I'd say we're doing well!
... That's good to know, but not us. I should've been more clear... is the ship ready for departure?
Oh, ha! I thought you meant us. Of course we're ready! We're always ready, Kanchou.
Wonderful. We had another message come in. We're departing tonight.
Yatta! I'll inform the crew. They'll be excited... new surroundings, new water to surf.
I'm glad everyone is looking forward to it. Hmm... Actually, you stay here. Frederic, why don't you inform the crew?
Yes, Captain.
Aww, I wanted to do it.

Fields.MenuText: I know, but celebrating isn't necessary right now.
I'm sorry. But I'd like you to be here, Nagatsuki.
Sometimes we want things we can't have.

Fields.DialogueText: Pooper! I wasn't going to celebrate...
Oh, well... there's always another time.
I like being with you too. I can share my time.
I can see the excitement in your eyes, Nagatsuki. You're practically dancing!
So, why are we going to Singapore?
That's what I wanted to talk to you about. We're escorting a troop convoy. We need to keep alert and ready for battle.
*ALARM*
Hai. Always. Like right now...
For the love of.... Yes, like right now.
@BATTLE
Painless.
We're ready, Captain.
We're heading out, then. To Singapore!
Nagatsuki... we're here.
Huhhh... why didn't you wake me?
*ALARM*
I did... we just got in. It looks like we're starting off on a bang though, so get ready.
@BATTLE
Sugoi! The rain is really coming down! I was hoping to get out on the water, but it might not be wise...
Yeah. I would certainly feel better if you didn't put yourself in danger that you can avoid, Nagatsuki.
Ha ha - I'll keep that in mind, Kanchou. What's our next move?
Waiting to receive further instructions. For now, standby.
Ooh, I know! "September In The Rain" sounds great with the pitter-patter of the raindrops.

Fields.MenuText: Nagatsuki, really? I need peace and quiet.
That's not safe right now, Nagatsuki. Remember, we're not here on a vacation!
It does go well with the rain... just keep it on a low volume, all right?

Fields.DialogueText: Music soothes, Kanchou. Let it in like the air, and you will temporary heal your anxieties.
Oh, come on! Dance with me! We can match our rhythm to both the song and rain!
I see a smile coming on... music touches even the hardest souls, Kanchou!
You can keep it on - but, please, don't let it drown out people's voices.
It's not bothering anyone, Kanchou. Everyone looks to be enjoying it, actually... including you.
I can't help it, I guess... I've grown to really appreciate the song.
I wonder what brought that on? Okay, I'll leave you alone. Call if you need anything, Kanchou!
Mata ne.
All hands to battlestations! Hayakushite kudasai!
@BATTLE
I see... good job, Frederic. Have the crew do the checks, and we should be out of here at twenty hundred hours.
Yes, Captain.
So, what do the orders say? Where are heading to?
We're escorting a convoy to Penang tonight.
Oh, but I haven't gotten to play in the water yet! Dang, I wonder if I have time now.

Fields.MenuText: I need you here, Nagatsuki. We have a lot to do before we head out and the last thing I need is to not know where you are...
I don't mind, if you can keep close. I need you to be of earshot, just in case...
Nagatsuki, we just don't have the time to lollygag.

Fields.DialogueText: It'll be really quick. Plus, it helps clear my mind for battle.
Oh, come on! I won't just disappear when you need me most...
Hai, hai. You're right...
I need you to oversee the checks being done before our departure. If you can get that done in a hurry, as far as I'm concerned you're free and clear. Just be here an hour before departure.
Hai!
You're excused. The faster you're out of - Hmm... she's way ahead of me.
Okay, listen...
Kanchou! This place is beautiful... and the people...
Don't get attached, Nagatsuki. You're asking for trouble.
I don't need to be told, Kanchou. I know what I am, but that doesn't change how I feel about people.
Fair enough. Honestly, I'm probably talking as much to myself as I am to you.
Well... I suppose I'm listening too. Either way, I am here to do my job and I will do it with precision.
*ALARM*
I believe that. For now, aim that precision towards those Morganas there...
Timing yo sugi!... I needed something to focus this energy on!
@BATTLE
Feel better? You look like you've unloaded a heavy boulder off your shoulders.
Hai. I'm just not good at waiting. If you don't need me later this evening, I'd like to have time to myself, Kanchou.

Fields.MenuText: I'll be fine without you. Come back refreshed, Nagatsuki. Your wellbeing is our wellbeing.
You're going to have to wait, Nagatsuki. I'd like you to be here as we receive further instructions.
Just give me a few minutes to find out if the coast is clear - proverbially and literally.

Fields.DialogueText: I just need a few minutes to soak in the moon and let the water wash over me, Kanchou. That's all I'm asking... a few minutes.
Sure... let me know when I can get this time to myself.
Oh, I'm losing my mind with this inactivity!
Hey. Are you really that put out about not having new orders yet? The patrols haven't exactly been quiet, and we're certainly not lacking work around the ship. It's not exactly dull around here.
Hai. There's activity. But it's not precarious! I live to LIVE... not just go about with my life in line everyday of my existence.
For what it's worth, as long as you're keeping up with your duties, I think you should live your life to the fullest outside of working hours. Surf, sumo events, whatever.
Hai! I'll get right to it, Kanchou! Mata ne!
I didn't mean right this second!
Yeah, I can understand that. I wish the war gave us more room to do something about it.
In my experience, at least, malaise is something you can fight.
Ah, dammit...
So, Kanchou... I wanted to apologize about the other day.
We all have our days, Nagatsuki. Are you feeling any better?
I had time to meditate with the moon and surf in this part of the world. I am in balance once again.
Wonderful. I'm glad you're here. How are fleet exercises?
They're fine... why do you ask? Is something wrong?
Oh, nothing. I haven't asked in a while and you haven't mentioned it lately...
I'm still carrying on with fleet exercises, but nothing new has been implemented.
I've actually been thinking about that - I'd like to focus on our defenses. Do you think you can include that in your exercises?
Hai! All you had to do was say so, Kanchou. Are we worried about something?

Fields.MenuText: Nothing at all. We just need to focus on our defenses right now.
Not worried, just preparing for anything that might come our way...
I'm not hiding any intel from you, if that's what you're asking.

Fields.DialogueText: I was just asking...
Oh, did I strike a chord, Kanchou?
Ooh, let me step out of the way of that bite...
Now I'm the one who needs to apologize - I'm sorry, Nagatsuki... It's just very serious to me.
I can see that. I will implement stronger defense strategies. There are no worries to be had here.
Thank you, Nagatsuki. I know that I can count on you.
I need to head out then, so that I can organize what tactics to enforce. Kanchou...
Yes, I'll see you later.
@BATTLE
Kyō wa!
And hello to you too.
Frederic, I need to ask you a favor.
Yes, Captain?
This is a favor rather than an order. Would you ask around and try to get a hold of the items on this list?
Hmm... okay. Picnic for you and Nagatsuki?
Dinner. I don't think we'll have the chance to have a proper dinner, but I think she'd like this...
I agree. I think she'd like it more than the original plan.
And you don't mind?
I figure you're tacitly offering me some shore leave to get it all, so... nope. Don't mind in the slightest.
Thanks, Frederic. Let me know if you run into any issues.
Yes, Captain.
What are we talking about?
Hi, Nagatsuki! Ah, nothing, Frederic was just leaving.
Hi, Nagatsuki... Umm, bye.
Sayonara! Ha... Kanchou, you two are obviously up to something!
I don't know what you're talking about. I'm just standing here minding my own business.
I'm sure that I'm right. You guys are acting the same way that you did when you were hiding the record! Teehee, is the surprise for me?

Fields.MenuText: Ha, you're clever. I still won't say.
Again, I don't know what you're talking about, Nagatsuki.
Shush... if it's a surprise, then no one is supposed to know until it happens.

Fields.DialogueText: Whatever. Either way, I know and I'm watching... and listening, Kanchou.
I don't believe you, but that's okay. I'm sure it's something for me!
Hai, hai. I won't pester you... too much.
*ALARM*
Well, how about you use that energy towards those guys?
Ha, ha... saved by the Funayūrei.
@BATTLE
Kanchou, a telegraph is coming in! Frederic is working on it right now...
All right. How are the fleet exercises going? Did they take well to increasing the defense measures?
They don't have a choice - but yes, Kanchou. A lot of them were impressed with my strategies. I did tell them it was your idea, though...
Ha, good. It sounds like they're taking to it easily then?
Hai. And here comes Frederic...
Captain. Is it safe to assume that Nagatsuki informed you of the incoming telegraph?
Mmhmm, go on.
It reads...
Captain,
Your next destination is Rangoon, escorting a convoy of troops. Prepare for departure and standby for further information.
Salutations.
That's it? Yes... all right. Thank you, Frederic. You know what to do.
Yes, Captain. I will inform the crew.
Hmm, Rangoon. We've been all over the place, lately. Busy is better than waiting around, I suppose.
I agree, Nagatsuki. And speaking of all over the place... the dinner. I was going to make it a surprise, but it's just been too hectic to keep up with it. I'm planning a dinner here for us.
Oh... that sounds wonderful, Kanchou. Would you like me to help? You replaced my record, there's no need to go beyond.

Fields.MenuText: I wanted to... for you, Nagatsuki. I'd like you to know that you mean a lot to me.
Yes, but this way you won't have anything to hold over my head.
Don't worry about it. It was part of my original plan, anyway. I'm just trying to carry it out before it drives me mad.

Fields.DialogueText: Okay, let me know if you need anything.
Aww, you're so sweet, Kanchou. I knew somewhere in that hardness was a special spot for me!
Such a stubborn kanchou... ha ha!
*ALARM*
We have company... we'll chat about this another time.
Ha! They sure know when to come in. Are you working with them?
@BATTLE
Joke!
I see... when will it be fixed?
It should take a couple of weeks. I'll talk to the mechanics and let them know a couple of weeks isn't in the time frame, and to try and speed things up.
Yes, do that... I don't know if we have two weeks to spare, Frederic. We have to be ready to go when they say.
Yes, Captain. I'll go talk to them.
All right.
Nagatsuki, what does the weather look like? You mentioned it looked like a storm was rolling in...
I'm just double-checking... Hai. We're definitely going to be greeted with a monster.
I see... should we be worried if we're called out?
Never. This is one of my pastimes, Kanchou. Look, there's something out there!

Fields.MenuText: Good eye... I can't really tell what it is, can you?
Ugh, it's like we have something attracting these bastards!
And this seems to be a pastime of mine...

Fields.DialogueText: It doesn't look friendly...
I enjoy it - practice for the big guys!
I think it's you, Kanchou. Misery loves company... ha, ha, get it?!
Ugh. Inform the crew. Let's get this out of the way, we have better things to be worried about right now.
Hai!
@BATTLE
All right, just set that over there and I think that's it for you, Frederic.
There. It looks really good, Captain. When is she supposed to stop surfing?
Not soon enough to light the candles and open the champagne just yet, but soon.
Well, I hope you...
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Kon'nichiwa... Oh, a surprise?!
Hello, Nagatsuki. Do you like it?
Hai! This is wonderful and so... romantic! So, this is what you and Frederic were up to!

Fields.MenuText: I'm glad you like it.
Now you have nothing to hold over my head.
It was a lot of work, but it happened.

Fields.DialogueText: Thank you, Kanchou. You really didn't have to do this...
I can't wait to see what's on the menu!
I'm really a good influence on you, Kanchou. You're living and taking in moments, creating memories!
Let me pour you a glass of champagne... Cheers!
Kanpai! Mmm, this is really good. Whatever is under the cloches smells great!
It's your favorite, Nagatsuki. I thought you'd like to have what you like the best.
Hai! Oh, you know me so well... I'd say we've grown to know each other quite a bit, wouldn't you say, Kanchou?
I think so. Oh, I also have a few reels of sumo wrestling for us to watch. This night is for you.
It's–it's nothing... these tears are of joy. I'm very surprised, Kanchou.
And you've brought me a lot of joy, Nagatsuki. It's the little that I can do that will never amount to what you've done for me. Thank you... to us!
To us!
... have fun.
Hey. What's wrong?
*sniff*
The orders are in, Captain. It's time.
Let me take a look...
Very well. Inform the crew that our departure is this afternoon.
Captain.
Looks like we're going to Rangoon... finally. I was beginning to think they were just trying to keep us on our toes.
Yep, it's time. How's everything look?
We've been ready for quite some time now, Kanchou.
All right, let's head out.
Captain, we have an unknown vessel approaching.
Of course we do... Calculate their distance, Frederic. Nagatsuki, can we take them out from here, if needed?
Gomen. They're still too far.
It's not friendly, Captain. We should prepare to battle.

Fields.MenuText: Well, what are you all waiting for? This isn't a meet and greet!
All right. Let's get this out of the way. We do have an ETA I'd like for us to meet!
That's what I expected. Come on, guys - show me what you all have been doing in your fleet exercises!

Fields.DialogueText: Ooh, you're feisty tonight, Kanchou!
Take it back a notch... it'll get here when they get here.
They're never friendly, Kanchou... I'm sure we would know if they were - and like I always tell you, we're always ready!
Yes, all right. It looks like they're close enough to take out and get out of our way before they make us late!
They are! You won't be late, Kanchou. We're on it!
@BATTLE
All hands to battlestations! Teki wa chikai!
@BATTLE
You look quite... preoccupied, Kanchou. What has your attention? Are we headed anywhere else?
We received intel... here.
Hmm... I see. Our work is done?
Our escorting mission is done.
Does that mean that we're finally going to get some needed R&R?!

Fields.MenuText: It does, but that doesn't mean we're going to be lax on exercises!
Yes... we can take a breather for a bit. But it's not a long one, I'm sure.
It means a mission is finished and another is on it's way.

Fields.DialogueText: Woohoo! We should celebrate the end of a mission and the start of another!
When the sun sets, the moon follows. We should use this time to refresh.
The crew will be excited to hear the news. They've worked really hard...
I think a small celebration would be nice. You all have worked really hard.
Hai! They would love that... do you need me to coordinate the party?
That would be wonderful. I can help, as usual.
Would you like to come out with me tonight... to surf?
... You know what? Yes, I would.
Change and let's go!
I'll meet you there!
Kanchou, I've started working on the celebration - I think we just want food, music, and dancing. Simple, but a good time nonetheless.
Yes, I think that looks good. Did you need help finding anything?
Arigatō - but I've got it all taken care of!

Fields.MenuText: Wonderful. You really know how to get things done when you're focused!
All right. Let me know if you need anything.
You're the best, Nagatsuki... have I told you that?

Fields.DialogueText: Of course! Did you doubt me?
I don't want to come off pretentious, but I'm sure you knew that I'd get it done!
Ha, ha... sometimes I think you underestimate me, Kanchou.
I'm glad that you're taking on the work, but I want you to know that you don't have to do it alone. I'm here for you if you need me.
I know that, Kanchou. I need you right now...
W-what do you mean?
Right there... we have company. I'm not sure what they are yet, but they're not here for the party!
Yes... all right. Let's play!
@BATTLE
Okay, I have to head out to do fleet exercises, and then I have to do some things for the party.
All right. You know where to find me if you need me.
I do know where to find you, Kanchou. Mata ne!
Where do you want this, Nagatsuki?
Hang on. What are you two doing?
It's okay, Kanchou... we have it all under control!
That's not what I asked...
This is just some stuff for the celebration. It won't be in here long.
Yeah, I just need it in here until I figure out exactly how I want it be set up!

Fields.MenuText: I understand. I will take your word and expect it out of here soon.
You both know how I feel about clutter...
I don't know if I can handle this for that long!

Fields.DialogueText: It's only for a couple of days, Kanchou.
It'll be out of here before you go mad, Kanchou.
All right. I'll draw up my plans and you'll be at ease.
That'll make me feel better. I can't wait until this celebration is over with, so then I can have some real R&R...
You're just not seeing the big picture. The small things matter, Kanchou.
I know... and now our cluttered bridge is showing all the smaller things that make a celebration.
*ALARM*
Now you're getting it! Hmm, but we may have to stop for now.
@BATTLE
Wow! It looks great, you two!
Thanks!
Arigatō gozaimasu!
It was put together in such little time, but you would never know it!
I agree! The lights, the sound, and the smell of food... everyone must be ecstatic!
Oh, they sure are, Captain! They can't wait to just relax...
It's well deserved!
@BATTLE
Everyone was so happy, Kanchou. I think this will be one of those days that everyone talks about when this is all over.

Fields.MenuText: You're the reason this happened, Nagatsuki.
I hope that this is part of my legacy.
Meh, it's just a pebble in the sand.

Fields.DialogueText: You're much too modest, Kanchou.
Don't inflate your head to the point of explosion!
An optimist to the end - aren't you, Kanchou?
Do you have any plans for after the war?
You mean once this is all over? ... I guess I haven't thought about...
Hmm... well, make some room for me then. We're a good team, and... I think we should keep it that way.
I agree, Kanchou... But no promises! Tee hee... for now, let's enjoy this moment...
*ALARM*
And will be even better deserved in a couple of hours. Dammit.
